image.altText: A man with glasses smiles for a photo in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: Despite knowing he had ADHD and years of experience in bureaucracy as a political staffer, Simon Behrakis still found navigating the medical system "really difficult". Now, he wants to change that.

title.children: How a Liberal MP's battle to receive ADHD treatment sparked an inquiry

image.altText: long-beach water quality sign

props.synopsis: Safety warnings are lifted at most of Hobart's beaches in time for Christmas. Meanwhile, the multinational owner of Cadbury's chocolate Factory is being investigated for the release of "high strength trade waste".

title.children: Swimming now safe at most Hobart beaches, as Mondelez investigated for health risk

image.altText: Person standing in white suit, purple hair that goes to black and is chest length.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Samuel Wellings, now known as Kim Dracula, saw the potential for TikTok to help them reach new audiences. It's led to a co-headline tour in the US and a feature on a concept album by the creator of Broadway musical Hamilton.Â

title.children: Kim Dracula covered a song at home and became an international star

image.altText: Man smiles for photo

props.synopsis: Sam Elsom's company is farming the red seaweed and ramping up supply to the industry, but he says the federal government could do more to encourage farmers to adopt the seaweed additive.

title.children: Seaweed feed pioneer laments 'missed opportunity' of government snub

image.altText: A woman wearing a blue cardigan and a young toddler wearing a brown dress sit on a couch in a sun-filled lounge room.

props.synopsis: More Tasmanian families are travelling interstate to access publicly funded IVF services, something that's not available to them at home.

title.children: 'It's really unfair': Calls for publicly funded IVF services in Tasmania

image.altText: A young woman with long blonde hair smiles, sitting on the ground surrounded by pots of colourful flowers.

props.synopsis: Jasmine Waddington had envisioned her life revolving around sports before a medical condition greatly restricted her physical abilities at the age of 15.

title.children: Did you miss? ð£ Woman discovers pigface passion after life 'completely changed' by POTS diagnosis

image.altText: The dark grey USS Harry S. Truman navy carrier vessel in dark waters along a cloudy horizon line

props.synopsis: The US military's Central Command said one of its navy's guided missile cruisers mistakenly shot down one of its F/A-18s over the Red Sea.

title.children: US Navy pilots shot down in 'friendly fire' in strikes against Houthis

image.altText: People lined up at airline counters in an airport

props.synopsis: Customers whose flights are delayed would receive a full refund and assistance in booking a new flight under a new aviation charter of rights being considered by the Albanese government.

title.children: Travellers to get refunds for delayed flights under proposed charter

image.altText: Jacinta is pictured behind an organ and wearing a rose on her black jacket

props.synopsis: Perth's oldest Catholic choir is thrown into upheaval following the sudden departure of its musical director, with members of the St Mary's Cathedral program vowing to boycott events until she is reinstated.

title.children: Ousting of long-standing musical director at Perth church sparks outrage

image.altText: People standing holding posters and banners

props.synopsis: An inquiry into nuclear energy has wrapped up after 19 hearings giving communities a chance to have their say on plans for nuclear energy in their towns.

title.children: 'What are we signing up for?': Communities react to nuclear power push

image.altText: An empty Christmas market, with medical equipment stewn across the street in the aftermath of the attack.

props.synopsis: A German magistrate has ordered the alleged attacker be held in custody on five murder charges as well as multiple counts of attempted murder and grievous bodily harm.

title.children: Boy, 9, and four women killed as German Christmas market attacker charged

image.altText: A woman in a broadbrimmed hat smiles.

props.synopsis: Skin cancer doesn't care how good you look in a cap, but a broadbrimmed hat might just save your life â and boost your style game.

title.children: Broadbrimmed hats in, caps out after four skin cancers

image.altText: Australia batter Nathan McSweeney looks sad.

props.synopsis: A month after achieving his dream on the back of six years of first-class cricket, it took just six Test innings to see Nathan McSweeney dropped for the rest of the India series at least.

title.children: Nathan McSweeney's sacking is a concerning and confusing throwback

image.altText: Oleksandr Usyk punches Tyson Fury during their world-title bout.

props.synopsis: Oleksandr Usyk prevails against Tyson Fury in an epic 12-round bout in Saudi Arabia to remain undisputed world heavyweight champion.Â

title.children: Usyk defeats Fury by unanimous decision to retain world heavyweight titles

image.altText: A man stands at the rubble of his destroyed home.

props.synopsis: People in Vanuatu applaud its latest show of resilience following a deadly magnitude-7.3 earthquake, but they say it can't respond to its cascading natural disasters alone.

title.children: 'You couldn't throw much more at people': Earthquake just the latest Vanuatu crisis

image.altText: A black and white sketch of a man with short hair wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: Decades after the Zodiac Killer rained terror over the San Francisco Bay Area, dedicated true crime sleuths continue to pore over the details of his murders, the letters he sent to news outlets and the puzzling codes that accompanied them. Will the mystery ever be solved?

title.children: For true crime sleuths, one American serial killer looms the largest

image.altText: People seen swimming in blue ocean water alongside yellow sand, a yellow surfboard and red pop up tent

props.synopsis: Australia's leading drowning prevention body has reported 18 drowning deaths since December 1, including six in New South Wales and five in Queensland.

title.children: Summer drowning deaths spike as lifesavers renew water safety warnings

image.altText: A man wearing a green cricket helmet.

props.synopsis: Captain Andrew Mansale will deliver the $3,000 prize money from the team's grand final win to the family of Valerie Kalkoa, who died in the earthquake.

title.children: Cricket team made up of workers from Vanuatu donates prize money

image.altText: Satria is crouched down looking intently at a reel of film spinning on a machine.

props.synopsis: Celluloid film all but vanished after cinemas transitioned to digital in the 2000s. There's only a few places left in the world dedicated to exclusively screening analogue film, and this is one of them.Â

title.children: The Australian film buffs taking on Quentin Tarantino at his own game

image.altText: A close up of Blake Lively

props.synopsis: The actor claims her co-star Justin Baldoni tried to "eviscerate" her reputation â an allegation he denies.Â

title.children: Blake Lively files complaint against It Ends With Us director for harassment and smear campaign

image.altText: A illustration shows a red rose mural on a wall, wedged between a yellow cab and a wheelie bin

props.synopsis: All year, I had been looking forward to launching my book in a city that never forgets, never forgives, let alone never sleeps. When I arrived in Manhattan, it was obvious grace was in short supply.

title.children: Revenge is 'like Ritalin' in post-election America, but I saw signs of grace

image.altText: The pair stand outside the Warakurna Roadhouse

props.synopsis: Two travellers finally paid more than $9,000 in wages owed from their time working at an isolated West Australian roadhouse say they hope their story serves as warning for others.

title.children: Spanish backpackers' months-long battle for thousands in unpaid overtime

image.altText: A deteriorating green dot sticker on a guidepost next to a road

props.synopsis: Advocates say an initiative that uses green reflector dots to signal upcoming stopping bays is a simple and cheap way to prevent road fatalities. However, they say more funding is needed to maintain and expand the program.

title.children: Green dots saving drivers' lives but 'more funding needed' for upkeep

image.altText: A website screenshot with a drone picture of resort. A headline reads "Welcome to the Ultimate Adventure - Anaconda Island"

props.synopsis: The Tiwi Land Council chief executive has accused retailer Anaconda of applying "its own name to Tiwi country" as part of a promotional competition.

title.children: Retailer Anaconda accused of 'disregarding Tiwi ownership of country'

image.altText: A hippo in water

props.synopsis: Pygmy and common hippos could be on their way to Australia in a bid to boost species numbers.

title.children: Australia set to become home to new hippopotamuses after 40-year ban

image.altText: A weathered house with yellow real estate signs on front fence

props.synopsis: Abandoned properties being sold by councils present an oasis of affordability for those willing to get their hands dirty.Â

title.children: Buyer picks up WA house for $2,000 'on a whim' as councils recoup debts

image.altText: a photo of a woman with blonde hair in her house looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Domestic violence agencies say old, unused phones could save lives as they respond to increasing demand for "safe phones" for survivors. Â

title.children: 'Safe phones' the key to saving lives in abusive relationships

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: I doubt you've got what it takes.

title.children: So, you think you're good at quizzes? It's time to play, HARD!

image.altText: Tents and tarps set up on dirt ground and rubbish left on the ground

props.synopsis: The Nigerian president's office says two crowd stampedes, one in the capital Abuja and another in the southern town of Okija, killed "many" people.Â

title.children: Dozens die in stampedes as cost of living bites in Nigeria

image.altText: Logan Martin celebrates during qualification at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Logan Martin overcomes the disappointment of his Paris Olympics campaign to claim a third BMX freestyle world championship.

title.children: Aussie Martin 'absolutely stoked' after winning third BMX freestyle world title

image.altText: a photo of a teenaged boy leaning against a car in a dairy farm paddock with a cow in background

props.synopsis: A charity that runs an early intervention program for vulnerable boys in regional areas says it's changing their lives and transforming their communities.Â

title.children: At-risk boys just need 'someone to believe in them' to transform their lives

image.altText: A red face mask with white fluffy trim next for a sanitiser bottle

props.synopsis: It's the most social time of the year for many of us. And when there's a lot of mixing with other people, there's always the risk of an infectious bug spreading.Â

title.children: How to keep your guests safe from gastro and COVID this festive season

image.altText: Jodi Wilson smiles while sitting at her dining table on a sunny day with bookshelves behind her.

props.synopsis: Every year I quit Instagram just before Christmas. A month-long break stops me from going into comparison mode as my family settles in for a holiday at home.Â

title.children: My summer holiday is better without Instagram

image.altText: Two displays of Santa that are similar to scarecrows.

props.synopsis: It's beginning to look a lot like Christmas in Kirup. The small Australian community is building a reputation as "Santa town" with its creative displays of the man in red.

title.children: Country town's Santas capture plenty of attention from travellers

image.altText: A woman wheels a red-lidded wheelie bin down a driveway onto the curb for pickup.

props.synopsis: Ernie Harbott's household has produced almost no landfill this year by reusing, recycling and composting.

title.children: Family puts general waste bin out for the first time this year
